definition: to support with the hand/to help sb up/to support oneself by holding onto something/to help
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)
husband/man/manual worker/conscripted laborer (old)
to help/to assist
assistance to the poor/poverty alleviation
to lend an arm to support sb
to assist
handrail/armrest
to foster/to support
ladder/staircase/escalator
to help the dying and heal the injured
to set sth upright or straight/to promote an employee from part-time to full-time (or from deputy to principal)/(old) to raise from concubine to wife status
to foster/to bring up/to raise
to help the poor/almsgiving for the needy/to assist poor households or poor regions
to skyrocket/to get quick promotion in one's career
to help those in distress (idiom)
taking everyone along, young and old/to look after the elderly and the young
Fusang, mythical island of ancient literature, often interpreted as Japan

sentences.english: He helped his sister out of the carriage.
The driver hastens next handlebar grandpa uprear, apologize again and again.
sentences.chinese: 司機趕忙下車把老大爺扶起，並連連道歉。

sentences.english: Would you help a dirty migrant worker stand up when he falls down?
sentences.chinese: 當一個骯髒的民工摔倒時，你會去扶他站起來嗎？

sentences.english: How dose she get so drunk? Come on, let's take her back.
sentences.chinese: 怎樣喝成這樣？來吧。扶她回去吧。

sentences.english: Felian: What’s meaning of “hold the wall when farting”?
They carried her to her chamber and laid her upon the bed.
sentences.chinese: 他們把她扶回自己的房間，攙到牀上。

sentences.english: I enclose herewith copy of the Letter of Credit.
sentences.chinese: 隨函我扶上信用證的副本。

sentences.english: He rushed to halp the old man up when he slipped on the ice.
sentences.chinese: 老人在冰上滑倒時，他跑過去把他扶了起來。

sentences.english: Can your canning hand me return to home?.
Old spent hens escorted out a small gray doves, flowers fort immediately face became pale and long.
sentences.chinese: 等老花母雞扶着小灰鴿一出門，花堡長立刻臉色大變。

sentences.english: A stewardess gives a pilot a hand as they disembark in France.
sentences.chinese: 飛機在法國降落後，一位空姐扶飛行員下飛機。

sentences.english: Penny: Oh, let me help you up.
I helped the trembling child off the horse and into the house.
sentences.chinese: 我把戰戰驚驚的孩子扶下馬，陪他進了房子。

sentences.english: Willing hands held my bike and helped me get my backpack off.
sentences.chinese: 那些熱心人幫我扶着車，又幫我把揹包摘下來。

sentences.english: He dismounted and helped Uxbridge down and then returned to the business of beating the French.
sentences.chinese: 他跳下馬，扶阿克斯布里奇下來，回頭就再戰法軍。

sentences.english: She helped her to bed and called a doctor immediately.
sentences.chinese: 她把她扶上牀躺下，立即請來了大夫。

to lift/to raise/(of two or more persons) to carry
to stand up
to fall down/to slip and fall/to throw sb to the ground

to drag/to haul
to pull/to tug at (sth)
to throw/to fling
to get up/to leave/to set forth
to support/to prop up/to push or move with a pole/to maintain/to open or unfurl/to fill to bursting point/brace/stay/support

to reach out with one's hand/to hold out a hand/(fig.) to beg/to get involved/to meddle
to squat down/to crouch

to sit/to take a seat/to take (a bus, airplane etc)/to bear fruit/variant of 座[zuo4]
surname Yao
to shake/to rock/to row/to crank
to hold/to carry (in one's arms)/to hug/to embrace/to surround/to cherish
to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
to get up on hind legs (esp. of horse)/to stand/to spring up
